page.title: 14EDUCATION WELFARE OFFICER
page.content: We had an interview with the Challney Schools{Education Welfare Officer.} This is what she told us: She deals with boys who stay at home too much eg.{truants.}She also deals with boys' personal problems which they are afraid to tell their parents. She interviews parents over school matters if there is felt to be a special problem. Miss Cockerill finds new schools for boys who are expelled or suspended too often. She deals with boys who are in trouble with the police. She asks the police what they have done wrong. She also visits junior schools once a fortnight to deal with the problems of children there. Another aspect of her work is to deal with families in need of financial help, this includes free dinners . Miss Cockerill says that she likes working at Challney.
